intro: Sphaeranthus engleri, commonly known as the Engler's globe flower, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with hairy stems and small, daisy-like flowers. Its leaves are usually opposite and covered in fine pubescence. Sphaeranthus engleri is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to thrive in arid to semi-arid environments.
